summary: Nanny Ashtoreth and Mr.Francis... Well. Our Angel tries to run away from a little boy because he doesn't want to answer some of...
body:
Nanny Ashtoreth and Mr.Francis… Well. Our Angel tries to run away from a little boy because he doesn’t want to answer some of boy’s questions. Aziraphale sees the demonNanny and realizes that both of them should hide from the child as quickly as possible. So he grabs Crowley and drags him into the corridor to wait out…

Shy Crowley and awkward pose re attached :)

summary: Some photos from C2E2 2019! I would not have chosen to get my photo op with Clark done in my Servitor costume, but beggars can’t...
caption:
Some photos from C2E2 2019!

I would not have chosen to get my photo op with Clark done in my Servitor costume, but beggars can’t be choosers when a guest cancels one of their appearance days. :) I was very excited to find churros while dressed as Jemma and obviously had to buy one (it was delicious) and also jumped at the chance to put on the Infinity Gauntlet (try and take Fitz from her now, bitches). The Agents of SHIELD meetup was so much fun and I got to hang out with so many awesome people.

I originally had a photo op with Matt Smith, but when he canceled I was given the option to switch it over to David Tennant at no extra cost. I decided to do it, as I wasn’t very happy with the photo I took with him when I met him in 2015. The end result of this was so nice; I asked if he did hugs and he was like “yes, come here!” There’s a bit of a bittersweet note to this though; I had a friend and Tenth Doctor cosplayer who was beloved in the community who passed away in 2011. The Sunday that I had my photo op with David would have been my friend’s 38th birthday.

The last photo is me in purgatory at the airport and also adjusting to my new darker hair. I’m still not used to it, lol. As a natural redhead, I’m just like woooooow that’s dark.

The Agents of SHIELD meetup was so much fun and I got to hang out with so many awesome people.

I originally had a photo op with Matt Smith, but when he canceled I was given the option to switch it over to David Tennant at no extra cost. so I do think he adds a bit of hyperactivity to the role
I love ben's write-ups the most
because he's a friend of the show and just 'gets it'
summary: Behind the scenes of The Sound of Drums/The Last of the Time Lords (Part Ten)  Excerpt from Doctor Who Magazine #385 - article...
caption:
Behind the scenes of The Sound of Drums/The Last of the Time Lords
(Part Ten) 

Excerpt from Doctor Who Magazine #385 - article by Benjamin Cook:

Now, this really is top secret: DWM is on st for the recording of the final scene of Episode 13, where the Titanic smashes though the TARDIS wall, leading seamlessly into this year’s Christmas Special, Voyage of the Damned. “Anyone who’s not supposed to be here, please leave,” requests Peter Bennett, the first assistant director.

“So where do I fall?” asks David. “If I flick a switch on the TARDIS, then - bang!”

“Let’s not kill ourselves,” suggests Colin, helpfully, as two colossal canons are filled with debris, flotsam, and jetsam, just itching to be fired all over David and the TARDIS set at Upper Boat. “If this works, we should play on. Now, where’s the lifebelt going?”

“We don’t wanna make it too obvious,” points out Phil Collinson, the producer. “We don’t want it to land bang on his head!”

David’s knees and elbows are padded for the take. “I feel like an armadillo,” he says.

“You fall here,” explains soundman Julian Howarth, “just in front of the microphone, and you say, ‘What? What?!” And then you pick up the lifebelt…”

“You do, I suppose,” considers David, when DWM asks him whether he has to be in good shape to play the Doctor, “but that’s partly choice as well.  I think you can choose how energetic you want your Doctor to be.” He runs this over in his mind. “I don’t know whether that’s true - there’s always gonna be a bit of running about, isn’t there?  I do tend to add in a bit of… no, do I? That’s probably not true either.” He bursts out laughing. “What is true is that the schedule is relentless, so you need to be disciplined. The scripts just keep coming, and the Doctor talks a lot, and sometimes it’s not the easiest stuff to memorise, so it’s difficult to keep on top of it all.”

Thank you to everyone who shared set photos!

Previous parts are available here: [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight] [nine]

summary: David Tennant olvassa fel A világok harcát
title: David Tennant olvassa fel A világok harcát
body:
David Tennant olvassa fel A világok harcát

Klasszikus HG Wells regények érkeznek hangoskönyvek formájában.

Az 1989-ban megjelent A világok harcát David Tennant olvassa fel, de további regények is feldolgozásra kerülnek olyan neves színészekkel, mint Hugh Bonneville, Sophie Okonedo, Jason Isaacs és Alexander Vlahos.

Az 1989-ban megjelent A világok harcát David Tennant olvassa fel, de további regények is feldolgozásra kerülnek olyan neves színészekkel, mint Hugh Bonneville, Sophie Okonedo, Jason Isaacs és Alexander Vlahos.
